intro: Adicea clarkei, commonly known as the Clarke's adicea, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many species with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with five petals and a distinctive corona. The leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface.
